entry.title: Robert Palmer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a football injury saved Robert Palmer (pictured) from being besieged at Kut, but he died serving with the relief expedition?

entry.title: Dangers of the Mail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that critics objected to Dangers of the Mail in the 1930s for government support of lewdness and in the 2000s for creating a hostile work environment?

entry.title: Robert Home (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Home was sent by the British Army to Canada in 1864 to report on the defence of the frontier against the eventuality of an American invasion?

entry.title: Leave the Door Open (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the bridge in the song "Leave the Door Open" almost split the band Silk Sonic apart?

entry.title: Smin Awa Naing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Smin Awa Naing's regiment mortally wounded Crown Prince Minye Kyawswa of Ava, effectively ending Ava's most serious invasion of the Hanthawaddy Kingdom?

entry.title: a song alluding to her childhood trauma and sexual abuse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Billie Eilish had to take a break from writing a song alluding to her childhood trauma and sexual abuse?

entry.title: 1994 Mascara earthquake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1994 Mascara earthquake destroyed every house in the Algerian villages of Shadlia, Hacine and Sidi Ali Cherif?

entry.title: Twin Falls "saucer" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Twin Falls "saucer" was later proven to be a hoax created by four teenagers?
